subject: Gardening
title: Sacrifice and Regrowth
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sacrifice and Regrowth usable.

hook.text: Grass thrives on being mowed. Cut it, and it grows back faster and thicker. That's not an accident.

buildup.text: Grasses evolved alongside grazing animals for millions of years. Their growth point is at the base, not the tip.

twist.text: Some plants deliberately shed leaves when attacked. The fallen leaves carry insect eggs away from the plant.

climax.text: Sacrifice strategies show that defense isn't always about resistance. Sometimes losing a battle wins the war.

punchline.text: Grass evolved to be eatenâ€”and to win anyway.
